intro: Castilleja cerroana, commonly known as the Sierra red globemallow, is a hemiparasitic plant found in the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and relies on other plants for some of its nutrients. The plant has reddish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite and sessile, with a rough texture. Castilleja cerroana often grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
